name: H
haiku:
Your single proton
fundamental, essential.
Water. Life. Star fuel.

name: He
haiku:
Begin universe.
Wait three minutes to enter.
Stay cool. Don't react.

name: Li
haiku:
Lighter than water,
empower my phone, my car.
Banish depression.

name: Be
haiku:
Heart of emerald,
your sweetness a toxic trap;
X-rays see through it.

name: B
haiku:
Just doing your job,
holding plant cells together.
No fireworks, no fuss.

name: C
haiku:
Show-stealing diva,
throw yourself at anyone,
decked out in diamonds.

name: N
haiku:
Forever cycling
from air, to soil, roots, crops, us.
Exercise addict.

name: O
haiku:
Most of me is you.
I strive for independence,
fail with every breath.

name: F
haiku:
Tantrums? Explosions?
First step: admit the problem.
Electron envy.

name: Ne
haiku:
There's no shame in it.
Advertising pays the bills.
Stop looking so red.

name: Na
haiku:
Racing to trigger
every kiss, every kind act;
behind every thought.

name: Mg
haiku:
Child of aging stars,
however brightly you burn
they will not return.

name: Al
haiku:
Spent kindergarten
endlessly writing your name.
One i or two i's?

name: Si
haiku:
Locked in rock and sand,
age upon age awaiting
the digital dawn.

name: P
haiku:
Report, Willie Pete.
Don't hide behind a smoke screen.
How many killed? Maimed?

name: S
haiku:
Disrupted first grade,
popping stink bombs, starting fires.
Still can't spell your name.

name: Cl
haiku:
Low road or high road?
World War I. Gas in trenches.
Or salt shared, tears shed.

name: Ar
haiku:
They named you lazy,
but it takes strength to resist.
To stand by. To shield.

name: K
haiku:
Leftmost seat, fourth row,
yearning for the halogens
on the other side.

name: Ca
haiku:
The horse's gallop,
the eagle's swiftness both framed
by your quiet strength.

name: Sc
haiku:
How to define you?
Transition metal? Yes? No?
Do labels matter?

name: Ti
haiku:
Aerospace stalwart,
is the stratosphere enough?
Or only the stars?

name: V
haiku:
Blush with excitement:
lilac, green, blue, and yellow,
shedding electrons.

name: Cr
haiku:
Fighting corrosion,
gallant protector of steel,
ready for dragons.

name: Mn
haiku:
Avoid confusion.
In place of your own name, write
"NOT magnesium."

name: Fe
haiku:
Anvil, axe, nail, plow,
engine, railway, factory.
Servant, friend, partner.

name: Co
haiku:
Traded from Persia,
a blue more precious than gold,
for a Chinese vase.

name: Ni
haiku:
Forged in fusion's fire,
flung out from supernovae.
Demoted to coins.

name: Cu
haiku:
Before the Bronze Age,
before history began,
bent to the smith's need.

name: Zn
haiku:
Clasp your neighbor tight.
Sound the music while you dance,
trumpet, bugle, horn.

name: Ga
haiku:
Melting in my hand,
agent in nuclear bombs,
feigning innocence.

name: Ge
haiku:
Do you miss it still,
the semiconductor crown
that silicon stole?

name: As
haiku:
Hauled in for questions,
blacklisted, cannot quite shake
your poisonous past.

name: Se
haiku:
So proud to be part
of each drop of formula,
helping babies thrive.

name: Br
haiku:
The shame of your name
now lost except to the Greeks.
No need to still fume.

name: Kr
haiku:
For twenty-three years
nobly accepted the quest
to measure meters.

name: Rb
haiku:
Temperamental.
Even water starts the flames.
Bunsen's fiery child.

name: Sr
haiku:
Deadly bone seeker
released by Fukushima;
your sweet days long gone.

name: Y
haiku:
That is not a name.
That is a spelling error.
Or a Scrabble bluff.

name: Zr
haiku:
Cosmopolitan,
as at ease in lunar rocks
as in S-type stars.

name: Nb
haiku:
Are you still pining
for the name Columbium,
its lost poetry?

name: Mo
haiku:
Mistaken for lead--
such injustice! Not deadly,
but vital for life.

name: Tc
haiku:
Unstable, short-lived,
yet found within red giants;
birthed in their bellies.

name: Ru
haiku:
Just below iron,
letting him hog the spotlight,
oh noble metal.

name: Rh
haiku:
Battling pollution
by transforming exhaust gas,
catalyst for change.

name: Pd
haiku:
How much hydrogen
must you swallow up to please
cold fusion dreamers?

name: Ag
haiku:
Treacherous treasure,
avarice tarnishing us,
photos claiming souls.

name: Cd
haiku:
Defined the angstrom
until krypton ousted you.
Now looking for work.

name: In
haiku:
Cadmium's daughter
by way of neutron capture;
adrift in stardust.

name: Sn
haiku:
Your magic number
a secret no one could guess
back in the Bronze Age.

name: Sb
haiku:
Outline eyes with kohl
in the ancient tradition.
Forego explosions.

name: Te
haiku:
So rare here on Earth,
because you fled into space.
Sighted by Hubble.

name: I
haiku:
A fortunate fluke:
found fuming from French seaweed,
sublime purple gas.

name: Xe
haiku:
First noble compound?
Hexafluoroplatinate?
Making history.

name: Cs
haiku:
Hot-headed firebrand
whose violent behavior
hides a softer side.

name: Ba
haiku:
Let those enduring
your enemas remember
fireworks' green splendor.

name: La
haiku:
Down in the cheap seats
underneath the main table,
leading your namesakes.

name: Ce
haiku:
More common than lead,
and yet an ardent member
of the rare earth club.

name: Pr
haiku:
Magnetic cooling.
Absolute zero beckons.
Approach the limit.

name: Nd
haiku:
Delved from China's mines,
mixed with iron and boron.
Strong magnets, high costs.

name: Pm
haiku:
Instability,
radioactivity;
lanthanide bad boy.

name: Sm
haiku:
Bone deep, such kindness;
curtailing cancerous cells,
easing others' pain.

name: Eu
haiku:
Defending euros,
contained in every banknote,
glowing in UV.

name: Gd
haiku:
Within reactors,
your appetite for neutrons
can be bothersome.

name: Tb
haiku:
Spent kindergarten
being teased: "TB, TB!"
Still hate your symbol.

name: Dy
haiku:
In Terfenol-D,
pulse to the magnetic beat.
Expand. Contract. Dance.

name: Ho
haiku:
The root of the name
elementary, my dear.
Stockholm, not Sherlock.

name: Er
haiku:
Internet helpmate,
improving fiber optics.
Rose-tinted data?

name: Tm
haiku:
Fifteen thousand steps
to gain the first pure sample.
Extreme chemistry.

name: Yb
haiku:
Stable to within
two parts in a quintillion:
atomic clock ticks.

name: Lu
haiku:
Helicopter dad,
keeping your electrons close
to your nucleus.

name: Hf
haiku:
Yield the holy grail:
induced gamma emission.
Let the price be low.

name: Ta
haiku:
Smaller and lighter,
your tiny capacitors,
digital darlings.

name: W
haiku:
Illuminated
the twentieth century,
glowing with such pride.

name: Re
haiku:
1925.
Found: new element. Stable.
The last to be caught.

name: Os
haiku:
Humiliated
underneath the dunce's cap,
densest in the class.

name: Ir
haiku:
The dinosaurs gone:
your fingerprint in the clay.
Incriminating.

name: Pt
haiku:
In a basement vault,
nestled within three bell jars,
the measure of mass.

name: Au
haiku:
Deep they delved for thee,
yet deeper still thy dwelling
in the earth's dark core.

name: Hg
haiku:
Madness the price paid
for your molten alchemy.
Metal. Planet. God.

name: Tl
haiku:
As a sulfate salt,
handy for killing rodents
or one's relatives.

name: Pb
haiku:
Lecherous plumber
with an appetite for both
acids and bases.

name: Bi
haiku:
Given a half-life
of ten to the nineteen years,
de facto stable.

name: Po
haiku:
Hidden in pitchblende,
gleaned by Marie and Pierre,
their radiant child.

name: At
haiku:
Naturally scarce.
Less than an ounce to be had
in the whole Earth's crust.

name: Rn
haiku:
Homeowners' hazard,
skulking down in the basement,
plotting your decay.

name: Fr
haiku:
Last seat, first column,
there maybe twenty minutes
before you vanish.

name: Ra
haiku:
Licked by the women
painting luminous watches.
How much time stolen?

name: Ac
haiku:
Captain of the boys
banished to the bottom bench,
troublemakers all.

name: Th
haiku:
Electrons display
relativistic effects
in the table's depths.

name: Pa
haiku:
Both of your neighbors
proffer nuclear power;
you clog reactors.

name: U
haiku:
Manhattan Project.
The elephant in the room,
never forgetting.

name: Np
haiku:
One small step toward
Pioneer and Voyager,
space ambassadors.

name: Pu
haiku:
Manhattan Project.
Climbing the tree of knowledge
for forbidden fruit.

name: Am
haiku:
Alpha particles
dispatched in smoke detectors
to protect and serve.

name: Cm
haiku:
Crew member assigned
to spectrometer duty
on the Mars Rovers.

name: Bk
haiku:
Face the firing squad.
Yield exotic elements
under bombardment.

name: Cf
haiku:
Freely fissioning,
spitting out enough neutrons
to start reactors.

name: Es
haiku:
Forged in the furnace
of E = mc2,
Ivy Mike's baby.

name: Fm
haiku:
Hydrogen bomb test
yields collateral science,
fallout bonanza.

name: Md
haiku:
Cyclotron harvest
named for the table's father:
seventeen atoms.

name: No
haiku:
No prize to award
for the decades disputing
your discovery.

name: Lr
haiku:
Silvery, we think,
guessing, not having seen you
with the naked eye.

name: Rf
haiku:
No known isotope
condescends to hang around
much more than an hour.

name: Db
haiku:
A silent soldier
in the Transfermium Wars.
Whose side were you on?

name: Sg
haiku:
Out, out, brief candle!
Mere minutes upon the stage.
Strut, fret, and exit.

name: Bh
haiku:
High-speed chemistry:
forming your oxychloride
before you vanish.

name: Hs
haiku:
Historic hassle,
crafting sodium hassate,
atom by atom.

name: Mt
haiku:
Merely conjectured,
your chemical properties.
No data at all.

name: Ds
haiku:
Nickel ions hurled
by the billions of billions
to score the first goal.

name: Rg
haiku:
In the group of coins:
copper, silver, gold, and you.
Untried, worth unknown.

name: Cn
haiku:
Electrons arrayed
in atomic orbitals
as if round a sun.

name: Nh
haiku:
A stable island?
Might heavier isotopes
linger for longer?

name: Fl
haiku:
Mirage? Mistake? Truth?
Would further neutrons lend you
a doubled magic?

name: Mc
haiku:
First fashioned by us
in this new millennium,
future uncharted.

name: Lv
haiku:
Nearing the end now,
the antepenultimate
seventh-row inmate.

name: Ts
haiku:
Our most recent find,
evanescent halogen.
New kid on the block.

name: Og
haiku:
The end of the line,
your millisecond half-life
brings down the curtain.

name: Uue
haiku:
Will the curtain rise?
Will you open the eighth act?
Claim the center stage?
